articles.title: Kim Kye Gwan Visits China
articles.content:
Kim Kye Gwan Visits China
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Kye Gwan, first vice foreign minister of the DPRK, and his party visited China at its invitation from September 16 to 20.
					 During their stay in China, they separately met Yang Jiechi, state councilor of China, Wang Yi, minister of Foreign Affairs, Zhang Yesui, executive vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and Wu Dawei, special representative of the Chinese government for the issue of the Korean Peninsula, and had candid and in-depth discussions with them on the issue of bilateral relations, the situation on the peninsula, the resumption of six-party talks and other matters of common concern.
					
					 They also attended an international seminar sponsored by the Chinese side to mark the 8th anniversary of the adoption of the September 19 joint statement and clarified the fair and aboveboard stand of the DPRK to protect the peace and stability on the peninsula and in the rest of the Northeast Asian region.

articles.title: Symposium on "Ode to the Motherland" Held
articles.content:
Symposium on "Ode to the Motherland" Held
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- A Juche-based literature and art symposium on new song "Ode to the Motherland" took place at the Pyongyang Grand Theater Friday.
					 Present there were Minister of Culture Pak Chun Nam, Chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of the Unions of Art and Literature of Korea An Tong Chun, and officials, creators and artistes in the field of culture and arts and teachers of art education institutions.
					
					 The participants listened to the recorded song that recently saw the light as a famous song of the era. 
					
					 Speakers said the song reflects the feelings of love for the homeland, deepens the pride and happiness of people living in the country and hardens the will of the army and people to defend and eternally glorify the precious motherland. They called the song a treasure of Juche music and the best song to be conveyed down through generations.
					
					 They described the "Ode to the Motherland" as a song which can be listed as a treasure of the great country led by the peerlessly great persons and as the second national anthem arousing patriotism of the army and people.
					
					 The song vividly represents the Koreans' feelings toward the motherland and the immense pride of the sun's nation, they said, stressing that the song is a paean of Songun Korea that will shine long together with the national anthem, and a model work of Juche-oriented music and arts, they noted, adding:
					
					 The song instills the truth of Kim Jong Il's patriotism into the minds of the army and people. Herein lies the great ideological value and artistry and tremendous vitality of the song.
					
					 The speakers called on all the creators and artistes to embody Marshal Kim Jong Un's idea on aesthetic idea and effect fresh innovation in the creation of music.

articles.title: Schoolchildren's Simulation Road Security Competition Held
articles.content:
Schoolchildren's Simulation Road Security Competition Held 
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- A schoolchildren's Red Cross simulation road security competition took place at Changdok School on Friday to mark the Day of Preventing Accidents. 
					 Present there were officials of the Red Cross Society of the DPRK, young RC volunteers, teachers and students of Changdok School and members of the delegation of the Red Cross Society of China headed by Executive Vice-President Zhao Baige, the delegation of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies working here and the visiting Red Cross donators delegation. 
					
					 The guests laid bouquets before the statue of President Kim Il Sung at the school and paid tribute to him in humblest reverence. 
					
					 Speeches were made and the competition was held on the subject of preventing road and traffic accidents. Its participants were divided into Ryongaksan team and Sunhwagang team. 
					
					 The guests talked to young RC volunteers about reducing the cases of traffic accidents, well aware of the common sense about traffic security and knowledge about first aid treatment. 
					
					 Red Cross activities for preventing accidents will go on.

articles.title: Chinese Red Cross Delegation Tours Pyongyang
articles.content:
Chinese Red Cross Delegation Tours Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Red Cross Society of China headed by Executive Vice-President Zhao Baige visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 The delegation members went round historic relics preserved with good care at the old home in Mangyongdae, being briefed on the fact that Kim Il Sung was born in the  low thatch-roofed house and spent his childhood there, nurturing his great intention to liberate the country. 
					
					 At the end of the visit the head of the delegation said: 
					
					 From long ago I have revered the great President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 The President worked heart and soul to turn Korea into a rich, powerful independent and sovereign state.
					
					 I hope that the Korean people would achieve great successes in building a thriving socialist nation, true to the behests of the President. 
					
					 The guests also visited the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Friendship Tower and other places.

articles.title: Chinese Red Cross Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Chinese Red Cross Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Red Cross Society of China headed by Executive Vice-President Zhao Baige left here Friday.

articles.title: Thai Foreign Ministry Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Thai Foreign Ministry Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Foreign Ministry of Thailand led by Damrong Kraikruan, director-general of the Department of East Asian Affairs, flew back on Friday.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Loving Care for Scientists Encourages DPRK People
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Loving Care for Scientists Encourages DPRK People
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The news about house moving in Unha Scientists Street here has evoked big responses from local people, especially scientists and educationists.
					 Kim Il Hwan, vice-rector of Kim Hyong Jik University of Education, told KCNA:
					
					 "Seeing the news on TV and in papers, I was deeply moved by respected Marshal Kim Jong Un's loving care for scientists.
					
					 Visiting the street some days ago, Marshal Kim Jong Un said that the Workers' Party of Korea would consider it as a main objective of construction in the future to build dwelling houses and rest homes for personnel in the fields of science and education.
					
					 His loving care for scientists greatly encourages science educationists.
					
					 We'll redouble our efforts to train more talented teachers."
					
					 Pak Ji Min, a department head of Kim Chaek University of Technology, said:
					
					 "House moving in Unha Scientists Streets is a happy event for all the local scientists.
					
					 Respected Marshal Kim Jong Un has treasured the scientists, attaching importance to science and highly appreciating their services.
					
					 Touring the apartment houses for scientists of Kim Il Sung University under construction, he said apartment houses would be built next year for scientists of Kim Chaek University of Technology, adding that the teachers who have dedicated all their life to bringing up the rising generation and training talents of the country are patriots and that there is nothing to spare for them. 
					
					 I'll train more talents greatly helpful to the building of a thriving socialist nation by bringing about a new turn in education of the rising generation and science education." 
					
					 Han Yong Gol, a merited scientist of Pyongyang University of Architecture, said that the scientists were enjoying wealth and glory under socialism before any other people, stressing that he would repay the loving care of the WPK with more scientific achievements.

articles.title: S. Korean Minister of Defense Accused of His Reckless Remarks
articles.content:
S. Korean Minister of Defense Accused of His Reckless Remarks
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet minister of Defense, Kim Kwan Jin, blustered at a recent "briefing on defense policy" that "the north plans the 4th generation war aimed to foment social confusion through cyber warfare, media warfare, terrorism, etc. in collusion with the forces following it in south Korea." He claimed the "plotted rebellion case" of the Unified Progressive Party can be viewed as part of "preparations" for it. 
					 He made no scruple of terming the positive measures taken by the DPRK to improve the inter-Korean relations what he called "tactical dialogue offensive".
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday in a commentary notes that what traitor Kim uttered is a deliberate provocation seriously rattling the nerves of the DPRK, a dialogue partner, and conspiratorial sophism inciting confrontation with compatriots and fanning up war fever in south Korea.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 By letting loose such nonsensical remarks to groundlessly find fault with the DPRK, he revealed himself his ulterior design to quell the daily growing desire of the south Korean people for national reunification through alliance with the north and chill the atmosphere of north-south dialogue.
					
					 Now that Kim Kwan Jin is becoming evermore reckless in his demeanor inciting inter-Korean confrontation, one cannot but question the south Korean authorities whether they are interested in mending the north-south relations and achieving detente on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 It is quite self-contradictory for them to talk about "dialogue" and "trust" with such confrontation maniacs as Kim Kwan Jin staying in office.
					
					 To eradicate the root cause of misfortune as early as possible is the only way of improving the inter-Korean relations and promoting peace and stability on the peninsula.
					
					 The south Korean authorities would be well advised to think twice over the adverse consequences to be entailed by such reckless remarks.

articles.title: Pyongyang Undergoes Radical Changes
articles.content:
Pyongyang Undergoes Radical Changes
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang, the capital city of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, has changed its looks with each passing day. 
					 Last year witnessed the erection of statutes of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill as well as the appearance of skyscrapers and the People's Theatre, built in Changjon Street along the banks of the River Taedong from Mansu Hill.
					
					 There also sprang up the Rungna People's Pleasure Park, Ryugyong Health Complex, People's Open-air Ice Rink and Pyongyang Folklore Park. 
					
					 This year the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum was splendidly renovated on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War (June 1950-July 1953).
					
					 Meanwhile, Unha Scientists Street and Haedanghwa Service Complex emerged new models of residential district and multifunctional service center. And sports and cultural service complexes such as Rungna People's Sports Park took their shapes in different parts of the city to provide the citizens with better living conditions. Many schoolchildren and other citizens enjoy a pleasant time at renewed pleasure grounds and parks every day, playing various kinds of amusement and sports games.
					
					 Lawn and flower gardens were created in a fresh way along streets, in residential quarters and around public establishments to add beauty to the scenery of the city.
					
					 Besides, such new projects are progressing apace as Munsu Swimming Complex, Mirim Riding Club, Children's Hospital and Dental Hospital to renew the looks of the capital city.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk's Exploits for Songun Revolution
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk's Exploits for Songun Revolution
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero, devoted all her life to the Songun (military-first) revolution pioneered by President Kim Il Sung.
					 In the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle, she showed the spirit of devotedly defending the leader in many fierce battles and at the Qingfeng Secret Camp. Such practices became a model to be followed by commanding officers and members of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk also performed undying feats for the liberation of Korea with arms. She displayed prodigious grit, flexible tactics, mysterious marksmanship and self-sacrificing spirit in various battles, including the battle to defend Chechangzi guerrilla zone, thus greatly encouraging the guerrillas to destroying the Japanese aggressors.
					
					 With Kim Il Sung's idea on comradeship taken as her creed, she did not hesitate to risk her life to defend her comrades-in-arms' political integrity or rescue their lives from danger in battles.
					
					 After the liberation of the country from the Japanese colonial rule, she worked heart and soul to find out children of the fallen guerrillas and bring them up as pillars for building a new country.
					
					 With the firm belief that the country can be defended only with arms, she devoted her all to building a regular army. Her care and efforts reached to everything like the foundation of Pyongyang Institute and other military academies, training of servicepersons in aspects of politics and military technique, designing of military flags and uniforms and production of weaponry.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk was a great revolutionary who dedicated all her life to the country and the people, performing undying feats in the history of the Songun revolution always with arms in her hands.
					
					 Her feats for the liberation of Korea and the building of Juche-type revolutionary armed forces serve as a mental source encouraging the Korean army and people to the victorious advance of the cause of the Songun revolution.

articles.title: Continued Suppression of Opposition Party Protested in South Korea
articles.content:
Continued Suppression of Opposition Party Protested in South Korea
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The south Korean "Measure Committee to Denounce the Intelligence Service's Fabrication of Plotted Rebellion and Suppression under the Pretext of Security" made up of civic and social organizations and the opposition Unified Progressive Party (UPP) held a meeting in Seoul on Tuesday in protest against the IS suppression. 
					 Speakers at the meeting accused the IS of conducting again a seizure and search operation against those concerned of the UPP under the pretext of the investigation into the plotted rebellion case. 
					
					 This is a farce orchestrated to calm down the angry people and revive "yusin," regarding the opposition party as a political scapegoat, the speakers said, and went on:
					
					 Truth is bound to be probed. The people should remain undeterred by the authorities' suppression. 
					
					 The people's struggle against the present authorities' horror-ridden policy for the revival of "yusin" is sure to win.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Paper's False Report Dismissed
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Paper's False Report Dismissed 
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Young people of south Korea affiliated with the Kwangju-South Jolla Provincial Federation of Youngsters for Defending Democracy and the Kwangju Branch of the "Youngsters Community's Hope in 21st Century" held a press conference outside the Honam News Coverage Headquarters of Dong-A Ilbo on Tuesday in protest against the conservative newspaper's false report. 
					 Speakers at the press conference recalled that Dong-A Ilbo on Sept. 2 released a false story that a youth and children's  organization urged youth and children to "join the youth and children's committee of the Unified Progressive Party (UPP)," not content with taking issue with those young people involved in actions for issuing declarations on the situation and candlelight actions. 
					
					 They also blasted the newspaper for telling one more lie in the story.  Quoting a guy concerned of the security authorities, the newspaper said that the "Youngsters Community's Hope in 21st Century" is styling itself a civil organization for sound movement of youth and children but its records prove that it has  served as a channel through which some youth and children advanced into the UPP after receiving ideological education. 
					
					 The speakers held that the security authorities suppress even youth and children under the pretext of false case in a bid to attack the opposition party by using them as a political lever. 
					
					 They demanded the newspaper kill the false story, release a correction and make an apology as early as possible.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences Posted on Website of British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences Posted on Website of British Organization
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted on its website on Sep. 9 "3. The Choice between the Soviet and the People's Revolutionary Government" in "Chapter 7 The People's World" of Part 1 The Anti-Japanese Revolution Vol. 3 of President Kim Il Sung's reminiscences "With the Century".

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Observed Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Observed Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Political parties and organizations of different countries posted special write-ups on their internet websites between September 3 and 10 on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The France-Korea Friendship Association posted an article illustrated with a photo of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The article said:
					
					 September 9, 1948 is the historic day when Kim Il Sung founded the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					
					 The President laid down the line of eradicating the leftovers of the colony of Japanese imperialism and enforcing democratic reforms and wisely led the struggle for implementing it, developing the DPRK into a sovereign and independent state with the genuine people's power and the constitution. 
					
					 Kim Il Sung is always alive in the hearts of not only the Korean people but progressive humankind.
					
					 The Brazilian committee for remembering General Secretary Kim Jong Il posted a photo of Kim Il Sung standing together with Kim Jong Il on Mt. Paektu and said in an article titled "Socialist Korea, people's country":
					
					 The DPRK is a people's country both in name and reality.
					
					 The Korean people are now stepping up the building of a thriving socialist nation to be proud of in the world under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The new appearance of Pyongyang befitting the dignity of the prospering DPRK is crystal of love for people, fruition of the patriotic devotion of Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un who worked heart and soul for the people.
					
					 The DPRK, the people's country, will prosper thanks to undisputed support and trust from the people.
					
					 The Socialist Party of Romania, the Communist Party of Germany and the Finland-Korea Society posted articles praising the exploits Kim Il Sung performed in the nation-building and Kim Jong Il in the Songun revolution under such titles as "President Kim Il Sung, the founder of the DPRK", "65 years of victory and glory" and "DPRK celebrating the 65th anniversary of its founding."

articles.title: Russian Papers Mark DPRK's Birthday
articles.content:
Russian Papers Mark DPRK's Birthday
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Russian papers carried portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, photos documenting their exploits and those of Marshal Kim Jong Un and photo-accompanied articles dealing with the true picture of the DPRK from Sept. 2 to 10 on the occasion of the 65th birthday of the DPRK.
					 The paper Pri Armurskiye Wedomostsi in an article titled "DPRK today" gave a detailed account of the fact that the Korean people with a 5000-year-long history and an excellent cultural tradition are greeting the greatest heyday in their development under the banner of the DPRK.
					
					 The paper Nizhegorodskaya Pravda introduced the principle of independence  in politics, self-support in the economy and self-reliance in defence adhered to by the DPRK in an article titled "DPRK, independent country" having subtitles "In conformity with its requirements," "It is necessary to maintain one's own stance", "Industrialization in a matter of 14 years", "Technologies display their great power", etc.
					
					 The paper in an article subtitled "Invariable Songun politics" said:
					
					 The banner of Songun held high by Kim Jong Il helped bolster up the defense capability of the country.
					
					 It is supreme leader Kim Jong Un who is now leading the DPRK, which has demonstrated its dignity as an independent power for 65 years.
					
					 He declared in a speech made in April last year that the country would as ever keep to the road of independence, Songun and socialism.
					
					 Pravda Primoriya also carried a similar article.
					
					  Komsomolskaya Pravda carried an article titled "Independent power" having subtitles "Great history of great power", "Country maintaining its independent line", "Powerful army" and "Bright future." It praised the 65-year-long history of the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Kye Gwan realiza visita a China
articles.content:
Kim Kye Gwan realiza visita a China
Pyongyang, 20 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El primer viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Kye Gwan, y su comitiva visitaron del dia 16 al 20 a China cumplimentando la invitacion de la parte china. 
					Durante su estancia, los visitantes coreanos se reunieron por separado con el consejero de Estado Yang Jiechi, el canciller Wang Yi, el viceministro ejecutivo de Relaciones Exteriores Zhang Yesui, y el representante especial del gobierno chino encargado de asuntos de la Peninsula Coreana, Wu Dawei.
					
					En esos encuentros fueron debatidos sincera y profundamente los temas de interes comun, entre otros, las relaciones bilaterales, la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y la reanudacion de las conversaciones a 6 bandas. 
					
					Kim y sus acompanantes tomaron parte en el seminario internacional en homenaje al 8o aniversario de la aprobacion de la Declaracion Conjunta del 19 de Septiembre, organizado por la parte china, y expusieron en esta ocasion la posicion justa e imparcial de la RPDC de defender la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y el resto del Nordeste Asiatico.

articles.title: Efectuado el seminario sobre "Himno a la Patria"
articles.content:
Efectuado el seminario sobre "Himno a la Patria"
Pyongyang, 20 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 20 en el Gran Teatro de Pyongyang el seminario de la autoctona idea literaria y artistica constatada con la nueva cancion "Himno a la Patria".
					A la ocasion asistieron Pak Chun Nam, ministro de Cultura, An Tong Chun, presidente del Comite Central de la Federacion General de Escritores y Artistas de Corea, los funcionarios, creadores y artistas del sector correspondiente y de la rama de cultura y arte, asi como los profesores de las instituciones de educacion del arte.
					
					Ante todo, los participantes escucharon la cancion creada como obra maestra de la epoca.
					
					Hubo discursos.
					
					"Himno a la Patria", que describe el patriotismo del ejercito y el pueblo de Corea y su orgullo y felicidad de vivir en esta patria y les hace redoblar la voluntad de defenderla y glorificarla eternamente, constituye un tesoro de la musica del Juche y la mejor de las obras maestras que se cantara en todas las generaciones venideras, apuntaron.
					
					Argumentaron que la nueva cancion puede ser creada solo en esta patria del pueblo coreano, que cuenta con los grandes hombres sin iguales, y significa el segundo himno nacional que estimula a todo el ejercito y todo el pueblo a trabajar con patriotismo.
					
					La cancion, que ha reflejado emotiva y realmente el sentimiento de todo el pueblo sobre la patria y el gran orgullo de la nacion del Sol, es la oda de la Corea del Songun, que se transmitira siempre con el Himno Nacional, y la obra ejemplar de la musica y arte del Juche, recalcaron. 
					
					Ella da a entender a todo el ejercito y el pueblo la esencia verdadera del patriotismo de Kim Jong Il y he aqui su alto caracter ideo-artistico e inagotable vitalidad, senalaron.
					
					Todos los creadores y artistas deben registrar en la creacion musical una nueva innovacion materializando la idea de estetica del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, concluyeron.

articles.title: Tiene lugar competencia para la seguridad vial de cruz roja
articles.content:
Tiene lugar competencia para la seguridad vial de cruz roja
Pyongyang, 20 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del dia de las medidas preventivas contra los accidentes, tuvo lugar el dia 20 en la Escuela Changdok la competencia de simulacion para la seguridad vial de la cruz roja de jovenes y ninos.
					A la ocasion asistieron los funcionarios de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, los integrantes de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de Jovenes y Ninos, los profesores, empleados y alumnos de la citada escuela y los miembros de la delegacion de la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja de China encabezada por su vicepresidente ejecutivo Zhao Baige, la delegacion de la Federacion Internacional de Sociedades de la Cruz Roja y la Medialuna Roja, que trabaja en Corea, y la delegacion de los donantes de la cruz roja, de visita en Corea.
					
					Ante todo, los huespedes rindieron homenaje al Presidente Kim Il Sung ante su estatua de bronce erguida en la escuela, tras depositar ramos de flores.
					
					Hubo discursos y se desarrollo la competencia bajo el tema de prevencion de los accidentes de trafico entre los equipos Ryong-aksan y Sunhwagang.
					
					Los huespedes conversaron con los miembros de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de Jovenes y Ninos con el tema de reducir las perdidas causadas por accidentes de trafico usando los conocimientos sobre la seguridad de transito y los primeros auxilios.
					
					Continuan las actividades de la asociacion de la cruz roja relacionadas con las medidas preventivas de accidente.
